results.title: Helping the child face the don'ts
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Personality Development”.
Shows that personality is shaped in children by conforming to the “don’ts” imposed by parents and the society in which we live. Typical situations showing the child in relation to his environment are shown.

results.title: Helping our boys help themselves
results.brief_description: One of the most hotly debated subjects in educational circles worldwide is the trouble many boys are having with traditional schooling and growing up in general. This program provides some practical and desperately needed examples of how two diverse secondary schools are helping their boys to help themselves. Boort Secondary College, a small, country Victorian school where the academic performance and social growth of boys is encouraged through the Building blokes program. Cleeleand Secondary College, a large, tough school in a disadvantaged and multicultural outer Melbourne suburb which helps its boys with the Gateway Project and Make a difference program. An excellent follow up program to “The Trouble with boys”. Study guide included.

results.title: Helping learners to learn
results.creator_credit: National Coal Board, Francis Gysin and Nestor Lovera
results.brief_description: A modern conception of training as a process of attaining objectives. The use of “feedback” from tests enables instructors to modify their courses and to adapt their methods to reach the objectives set. Training is presented as a precisely designed instrument for attaining precisely defined ends. Intended for instructors in the coal industry.

results.title: Helping hand
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Heart of the matter”.
Explains how current EEC policy of dumping surpluss food on Third World Countries simply encourages governments to do nothing about their own problems and that cash aid is preferable as it can be used to directly improve the infrastructure. Also the logistics involved in the distribution of EEC surplus in Ethiopia.

results.title: Helpful Henry
results.brief_description: City boy spends summer on a farm and seems to think they should change their way of living. He has his own ideas about how things work, but eventually finds he is wrong and needs to learn from others.

results.title: Helpers: personalising the instruction of reading (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Veriation Films, KTEH-TV (Television station : San Jose, Calif.), Louise Henry and David Espar
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the use of supportive personnel in individualising instruction and meeting the needs of students. Illustrates the process used to prepare teachers to work with volunteers, and the professional relationship which exists between the principal, teachers and volunteers.
